snippet: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan engaged in a fluent and combative exchange over the Obama administration’s handling of foreign affairs and the nation’s economic recovery.
abstract: Vice President Joseph R Biden Jr and Rep Paul D Ryan engage in fluent and aggressively quarrelsome exchange at vice-presidential debate over Obama administration’s handling of foreign affairs and nation’s economic recovery; debate offers spirited airing of sharp contrasts between the two parties.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and JIM RUTENBERG
byline.contributor: Jeff Zeleny reported from Danville, Ky., and Jim Rutenberg from New York.

lead_paragraph: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. and Representative Paul D. Ryan engaged in a fluent and combative exchange over the Obama administration’s handling of foreign affairs and the nation’s economic recovery.

headline.sub: With Stakes High, Candidates Wrangle for Upper Hand
headline.main: Biden and Ryan Quarrel Aggressively in Debate, Offering Contrasts
headline.print_headline: Biden and Ryan Quarrel Aggressively in Debate, Offering Contrasts
